content:
That's wonderful! It sounds like you're developing a deeper appreciation for art and even exploring your own creativity. Buying art from a friend's studio is a great way to support local artists and build a personal connection with the artwork.

"Sunset Dreams" sounds like a lovely piece, and I can imagine it being a beautiful addition to your morning routine. Having art in our daily lives can be so uplifting and inspiring.

It's also fantastic that you're taking an online art course and experimenting with mixed media collage. Working with different materials like old maps, newspaper clippings, and fabric scraps can be so much fun and lead to some amazing creations. Seeing what other students are working on can be a great source of inspiration and motivation.

Have you considered displaying your own artwork alongside Emma's piece and "Blooming Garden"? It could be a great way to create a cohesive look and showcase your own creative journey. You might also consider sharing your artwork with Emma and getting her feedback or advice. Who knows, you might discover a new talent or passion!

Remember, art is a journey, and it's okay to experiment and try new things. The most important thing is that you're having fun and enjoying the process. Keep creating and exploring, and I'm sure you'll discover new talents and interests along the way!
